A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Been a Star Wars fan since '87.  Grew up with the originals.  Was disappointed by the prequels\, but still enjoyed them as Star Wars films.  I loved Force Awakens.  I really liked the Last Jedi\, but didn't love it like I loved the Force Awakens.  I could feel the hand off from one director's vision to another.  It didn't flow like I was expecting it to.  With that said\, I still really liked the vision Rian Johnson had for the film.  It was unexpected throughout.  I was still left with wanting something more by the credits.  I don't know if this was intentional or if it was because it skipped over many plot holes created by Force Awakens with no explanation (Who's that Snoke guy???).  Overall I give this a good rating because it still felt like a Star Wars film and the story line was very enjoyable.  Cinematography was great\, editing was on par.  I can see why the Star Wars lore fanatics hate this movie.  I feel like this movie's quirks was intentionally made to piss them off.  For someone who genuinely loves Star Wars\, I had no qualms with it.
